title: PHPsizeof()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPsizeof()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the number of elements in an array: Definition and Usage The sizeof() function returns the number of elements in an array. The sizeof() function is an alias of the count() function. Syntax sizeof( array, mode ) Parameter Values Parameter Description array Required. Specifies the array mode Optional. Specifies the mode. Possible values: 0 - Default. Does not count all elements of multidimensional arrays 1 - Counts the array recursively (counts all the elements of multidimensional arrays) Technical Details Return Value: Returns the number of elements in the array PHP Version: 4+ More Examples Example Count the array recursively: array ( "XC60", "XC90" ), "BMW"=>array ( "X3", "X5" ), "Toyota"=>array ( "Highlander" ) ); echo "Normal count: " . sizeof($cars)."
"; echo "Recursive count: " . sizeof($cars,1); ?> ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
array ( "XC60", "XC90" ), "BMW"=>array ( "X3", "X5" ), "Toyota"=>array ( "Highlander" ) ); echo "Normal count: " . sizeof($cars)."
"; echo "Recursive count: " . sizeof($cars,1); ?>

"; echo "Recursive count: " . sizeof($cars,1); ?>
practice_exercises.solution:

"; echo "Recursive count: " . sizeof($cars,1); ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPsizeof()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPsizeof()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPsizeof()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
